intro: Besleria fallax, commonly known as the wax plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, glossy leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It thrives in humid, warm environments and requires well-draining soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded garden settings.
